Title.evidence: Graft Delamination in Early-Cannulation Arteriovenous Grafts: A Retrospective Cohort Study

Participants.evidence: Participants included 141 end-stage renal disease (ESRD) patients requiring ecAVG for HD.

Intervention.evidence: The study also assessed the effectiveness of different treatment modalities, including percutaneous transluminal angioplasty (PTA), stenting, and partial graft replacement (PGR).

Objective.evidence: This study aims to evaluate the incidence, management, and impact of graft delamination on the long-term patency of ecAVGs.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of graft delamination, measured over a median follow-up of 24.5 months.

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 144 ecAVGs were analyzed, comprising 124 Acuseal and 20 Flixene grafts.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The primary patency in the delamination group was significantly lower than in the non-delamination group (p < 0.05).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events included thrombosis and venous hypertension, with seven delaminations observed shortly after endovascular procedures.
